channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12665] When aborting, dump metrics
item.description: We used to dump out all metrics when we were exiting on abort. Was of use debugging why the abort. We used to have this. Jean-Daniel Cryans noticed it was dropped by his brother Elliott Clark over in HBASE-6410 "Move RegionServer Metrics to metrics2" To stop the two brothers fighting I intervened with this patch.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Refactor the /jmx json emissions on beans so can be used in HRegionServer#abort
Metrics will be dumped on stdout, in the .out file.
I think your first cut is missing something, I see you lifting a bunch of stuff from JMXJsonServlet into JSONBean but the former still has most of the latter's code.
Jean-Daniel Cryans you are right. thanks.

Hard to write a test for this. I tried /jmx in UI and looking in tests that abort I see this:


 781 2014-12-09 13:44:21,244 FATAL [main] regionserver.HRegionServer(1921): ABORTING region server kalashnikov-19.att.net,61685,1418161460417: I'm dead

Address Jean-Daniel Cryans review.

So nice of you stack, maintaining family harmony during the holiday season.

+1 on the 2nd patch. Nice one folks.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12686104/0001-HBASE-12665-When-aborting-dump-metrics.patch
against master branch at commit 5537fce3536209a9331b44fbe163cd63b41e2fac.

This message is automatically generated.
Test failure looks legit

stack From a usability standpoint, how many lines do you get when dumping the metrics? Looks like it would go in the hundreds (also you are showing the master's metrics, standalone?). What I liked about what we had before was that it was concise and contained mostly stuff I was interested in, whereas now we seem to be getting all the histograms. Also, it goes to stdout instead of being logged, was that intentional? I'm not sure how that's gonna come out if there's loads of stuff being logged (like it usually is when a RS is aborting), it might get mixed a bit. Finally, it would be nice to get some description of what's being dumped. I was actually confused when I saw this part:

2014-12-09 13:44:21,244 FATAL [main] regionserver.HRegionServer(1927): RegionServer abort: loaded coprocessors are: [org.apache.hadoop.hbase.coprocessor.MultiRowMutationEndpoint]

{

  "beans" : [ {

It felt like the metrics were a continuation of the coprocessors printout. I'm easy to confuse so that might just be me.

Thanks for picking this up. In this time of the year, family values are more important than ever.

Don't worry Jean-Daniel Cryans you're still on my Christmas card list.

My only concern is about doing this is that we're going to obscure the errors if this scrolls too much text. Can we choose a subset of mbeans ?
Test failure was legit. Need to flush first before setting response code.

It dumps all beans into stdout. Hundreds of lines yes... the JMX output. The emission was for standalone/unit test yes. Just demo'ing it 'works'.

What I liked about what we had before was that it was concise and contained mostly stuff I was interested in

What you interested in? Metrics are spread around a number of beans. Yes, a bunch of operations have histograms now. The output looks kinda useful when server crash is 'fatal' (minus perhaps runtime bean dumping classpath again).

Stdout is intentional, yes. Could make a 'String' and then give that to logging system but seems a bit obnoxious when in a fatal state.

Finally, it would be nice to get some description of what's being dumped. I was actually confused when I saw this part:

Let me fix.

Let me see if I can do an edit on the output.. do a few beans only.
Here is a sample. Almost 200 lines dependent. Left out most stuff including by region.

Only dump three beans – Server, IPC, and Memory. Do the JSON dump into a String and then emit it as LOG.info as it used to be back before metrics redo.
Rebase

+1, still seems like a lot but better than showing everything. Also, I like it better when logged like that. We could also consider printing it out in a more compact way, it's basically how the metrics dump was before, but we can do later if needed.

It seems that 0.98 will need a different patch.
+1 nice patch. Thanks stack

+1 nice patch. Thanks stack

Thank your brother! He found the prob (smile)

Closing this issue after 1.0.0 release.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: When regionserver aborts, we dump subset of metrics into the log (We used to do this too pre-0.96 but was lost when we refactored metrics)
